country:
None
text:
This was so unique and delicious. I followed the recipe except I used 4 tsp flour.  Before our two guests arrived I measured out the ingredients and mixed the dry and liquid ingredients separately. Then I waited until we'd finished the main meal before mixing it all together and cooking it. Topped it with ice cream and a little toasted coconut. Everyone raved. I don't think I could make this for more than four people since it takes some time to turn out each little cake after it's finished cooking and put the ice cream on it - because the little custard dishes are so hot. The one thing I might change is trying to coat the cups with butter and sugar instead of flour. It would have been prettier, but I don't know if it would fall out as easily as it did with flour. But with ice cream on it, no one could tell.

text:
This recipe is awesome! I've made it twice with slight modifications (used mini semi-sweet chocolate chips and had to bake for about 1 hr 30 mins) and it came out perfect each time! I debated on adding the chantilly glaze as others have suggested but have been told (by several chocoholics) that it is moist and rich enough without glaze or frosting. The powdered sugar adds a nice presentation and subtle, off-setting sweetness that keeps this dessert simple yet surprisingly scrumptious!

text:
The best chocolate cake I have ever made!  I added about 1 - 2 Tbs of cocoa, and 1 Tbs icing sugar, and increased the water to 2/3 cup.  This will be the only chocolate cake recipe I will use!  It is full of rich chocolate flavour, there is no need for icing.  The only improvement I would make would be to chop up the chocolate chips a bit; most of them melted into the cake, but there were a few that didn't and it didn't go well with the fluffy texture.

text:
I have looked and looked and looked for a recipe that is THIS MOIST and I have finally found it!!!!!  The cake stayed moist, almost wet in fact!  The only gripe I would have is that it does taste kind of oily (a trade-off for the moistness I suppose!), so next time I will try the 1/2 cup oil, 1/3 cup milk variation.  The glaze is too much to the already sweet cake...a butter cream or cream cheese frosting would go better.  USE GOOD COFFEE INSTEAD OF WARM WATER!  It adds really good flavor...I also put a dash of vanilla in for depth.  Overall, what I had been searching for!

text:
I sent this cake to work with my wife for a halloween pot luck they were having . There were many other desserts there and she told me that everybody liked mine the best. A small portion came home and I tried a piece....yummy!!  But be warned, I went for seconds and before I got 3 bites into that second piece, I developed a belly ache. This cake is very rich!!! One delicious piece per person is all that is nessecary unless you are a dessert eating champion!! This cake is very chocolaty!!! I did top it with chocolate ganache so maybe that put it over the top..but that got raves as well and very easy to make, just 10 ounces bittersweet choclate and a cup of boiling cream whisked together. Seriously folks, this cake should come with a warning label on it!!

I always use ways to reduce calorie content without sacrificing taste! If I was taking this to a potluck or event, I'd probably make it by the recipe, but this lower-calorie version is perfect for my family.

text:
I started using this recipe in May, and I have made it probably 10 times since then. It is my "go to" recipe for cakes and cupcakes. We like to try different flavors, and my boyfriend's favorite is Mint Chocolate Chip. You can use Mint Pudding instead if you'd like, or just add Andes Mints instead of chocolate chips. I've also used white chocolate pudding and chips, and I'm looking forward to making lemon. This is the best recipe I have ever tasted...the sour cream was a bit scary at first, but now I add it to almost everything I bake...it truly makes the difference. Thank you SO much Denise!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
The best chocolate cake recipe I've found so far.  I've given up trying to make chocolate cakes from scratch as they tend to be too dry.  I made this for a rehearsal dinner - skipped the chocolate chips in the batter, and baked in a large 12 inch round pan.  I brushed it with a simple syrup w/vanilla and frosted with chocolate ganache, decoratiing with mini chips on the side.  I thought it would be too soggy with the syrup, but folks raved about how moist it was.  I made a similar one for my husbands finicky firefighters and they loved it too.  A great cake base for all your chocolate cake recipes.  I will be keeping this one for sure!

text:
Delicious, moist, yummy!!! The only change I made to the recipe was to substitute the oil with 1cup of apple sauce. I also preferred to use low-fat sour cream. This was my one and only attempt at this cake, and it turned out exquisite. After all the rave reviews it got, I had no doubts. Everyone in my family rated it 5/5! AAAAh! I made another change, due to my fear of it being toooooooo chocolaty :) I used 1 cup of chocolate chips and 1cup of peanut butter chips. I was afraid of it being too sweet, but I was presently surprised of its semi-sweetness:) Looooooove the melted chocolate!!!

text:
Our family loves this cake. It is wonderfully rich and moist, and very, very chocolately. We have made this recipe more times than we can count. Very easy to make, especially since you do not have to ice it! It definitely does not taste like a "doctored up cake mix". If you are looking for an amazing, easy, cake that tastes like you put lots of hard work into it, here is the cake for you! My recommendation is to warm it up in the microwave to make it taste as though it just came out of the oven. One of our favorite recipes that will remain in our family cookbook forever!

Very moist, incredile chocolate taste, and the melted mini-chocolate chips were amazing!!!!  We didn't have a bundt so we used 2 bread pans and cooked exactly as written.  This one I printed for the recipe book!  A true keeper considering how easy this is to make!!!!!

I made this cake exactly as the recipe called for and it turned out wonderful! I baked mine in a glass 9 x 13 pan instead of a bundt pan and did not have any problems. It still needed to cook the 55 minutes. I did frost mine with chocolate frosting. I will make this again!

The Ultimate Chocolate Cake--I don't think I've ever had one this moist, rich & simple!  I followed another reviewer's suggestion to trim calories (sugar-free pudding, fat-free sour cream, 2/3 cup applesauce-1/3 cup oil) and it was still incredible. Ten people (many watching their waist lines) at a birthday get-together devoured it & my sister-in-law declared I should have baked cakes for a living. (I'll never admit it starts with a cake mix!) Can't wait to try other variations. Thanks for an awesome recipe & the helpful suggestions!

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674137.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Very moist and chocolaty; enjoyed it very much.  It does have a slight "artificial" flavor, but if you regularly eat cakes from a boxed mix you won't notice it.  As suggested by other reviewers, I reduced the oil to 1/2 cup and added 1/3 cup milk.  I also used miniature chocolate chips instead of regular.  Finally, I drizzled it with the "Satiny Chocolate Glaze" from this web site.

text:
This was great.  I do think mini chocolate chips would be even better (as a previous reviewer mentioned).  I put this in 2 9" round pans and cooked it for 45 minutes it worked perfectly.  After the cakes had cooled, they settled, so they were not raised in the middle, like my cakes always do.  I loved this because I didn't need to shave off the top to set them on top of each other, making a cleaner, easier assembly process.  Would make again!

text:
I've made this chocolate cake twice with the satiny glaze and it was incredible.  I tried it with variation of a lemon cake, lemon pudding and white chocolate chips.  It did not come out the same at all.  The white chocolate chips settled to the bottom of the cake and the bottom 1/2" of the cake was very sticky and actually stuck to the pan.  When I did get it out, that sticky part was now the top of the cake and just crumbled off, while the rest of the cake was perfect.  Also making the satiny glaze with white chocolate chips did not work either. Next time I will have to leave the chips out of the cake and find another white chocolate glaze for the top.

text:
This was fantastic. I baked it exactly as the recipe called for, except for using a 12 oz bag of mini chocolate chips instead of regular sized chips based on numerous reviewers recommendations. It was perfect. I topped it with Satiny Chocolate Glaze from this website, which made it that much better! The submitter suggests allowing cake to cool for at least an hour and a half, doing so allows the chips to solidify again. But, this cake is really good warm too if you can't wait. You can alway taste it when it's cool the next day...if there are any leftovers!

None
text:
I really like this recipe, it does not taste like a doctored mix – it is extremely chocolaty. I have followed the recipe to a “t” and it has turned out perfectly each time, rave reviews and requests from everyone. The one tiny thing I alter is I take the 2 cups of chocolate chips (I like the taste of 1 cup semi and 1 cup milk) and pulse them in the food processor until they are in smaller pieces. This ensures several tiny delectable morsels of chocolate in each bite without the chips dropping to the bottom or being obvious that I threw chocolate chips in the batter. Great recipe!

The flavor is decent, but the pudding mix gave it a processed aftertaste.  Also, it is a very dense, moist cake - almost like a brownie.  I used egg whites & applesauce to cut back on calories/fat & baked at 325 as suggested by other reviewers.  It's good, but it left something to be desired. Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/196835.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Wow, what a chocolate extravaganza!  I made the recipe exactly as directed and added a chocolate buttercream frosting on top and it was the extreme chocolate experience I was hoping for.  It tasted a lot like packaged chocolate brownies with chocolate chips and chocolate frosting, but I thought that was delicious!  I did coat my choc chips with flour which helped suspend them throughout the batter, rather than sinking to the bottom, as one reviewer had suggested.  Definitely I think using mini-chips would be good for the next time I make this so the chips are smaller amounts throughout the whole cake.  I felt like the large chips were just a little too much when you'd bite into them, though they were good.  I baked it for 45 minutes and it was obviously not cooked enough yet, so I put it in for another ten minutes and could smell it starting to burn 8 minutes into it (ie. at total of 53 minutes).  I mention this so everyone knows to be sure to watch it closely - it goes from undercooked to overcooked very quickly.  Luckily, I caught it before it burned and it was still extremely moist and tasy.  Good recipe for chocoholics!

text:
Made this exactly as recipe stated & it was absolutely amazing! I did make the "Satiny Chocolate Glaze" in the microwave to save time & I don't have a double boiler. I microwaved all the icing ingredients (except vanilla) for 30 seconds, stirred well and did an addl. 30 seconds. PERFECT & it makes a sinful amount. These two recipes were meant for each other. I had many takers to lick the bowl & spoon. We had late night guests over after a concert and we devoured this cake & (decaf) coffee. Moist, rich, smooth...chocolate lovers have found their soul mate with this recipe. Imagine all the flavor possibilities you could have just by changing the "chips"......butterscotch, mint, white chocolate.......no doubt in my mind, this will be made many times to come.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This cake really is good, and its perfect for people who like darker chocolate because of all of the semi-sweet chips!  I made the recipe exactly as shown, except I used 12 oz of the mini chips because I didn't want them to sink.  The batter it makes really is so thick that I'm not sure its necessary, so I think next time I'll try with the regular chips!  A lot of people said that after 50 minutes, the toothpick wasn't coming out clean.  I had the same thing happen, but its hard to tell if its the batter that isn't done, or if there are just SO many chocolate chips that you happened to poke a melted chip instead!  :)    I left it for 60 minutes and it was perfect, and I'd definitely make it again!

text:
This recipe is great.  I've been using the same recipe for years.  I got it from Dom DeLuise's cookbook.  The only thing I do different is I add the chocolate chips to the batter, bake it for an hour.  Then I melt a can of chocolate frosting in the microwave and pour over the cake.  My family loves it and it's always a hit at family get togethers with a big glass of cold milk!

text:
I made this recipe, and followed some of the suggestions - I used 3/4 cup oil, and 1/2 cup STRONG coffee instead of H2O.  Also used mini dark chocolate chips.  I made three 8" layers, and filled them with a mixture of chocolate fudge pudding, cool whip, cream cheese and 1/2 cup of the same coffee.  It was light and "mocha" flavored and delish!  For icing I used chocolate fudge frosting mixed with 2 tbls. coffee liquor, amd topped it with some pretty designs with white frosting and dark chocolate espresso beans!  AMAZING!!

text:
When they say "Too much chocolate cake" that could be right.  It's very chocolaty!  So I tried a few other cake/pudding/chip combinations and they all came out great.  I did a yellow cake/white chocolate pudding/chocolate chip combo and a cherry chip cake /vanilla pudding/cherry chips combo, as well as a german chocolate, chocolate pudding, choc. chip combo reducing the amount of chips needed in each.  There were a few too many for us.  It's fun to try new combinations and change out the frostings on top.  This website has taught me you don't have to stick exactly to the recipe if you don't want to.  And reviews give great advice.

text:
Especially for the ease, this is a very good cake! The consistency is perfect. I have had trouble in the past with cakes w/ pudding in the recipe in that the outside is a little crunchy by the time the middle is done. so i baked this cake for longer at 300 instead of 350. it was perfect! I did cut the oil to 1/2 cup and used a food processor to chop the choc chips b/c I didn't have mini ones. I cut down to 1 cup of choc chips as others recommend, but will try 1 and 1/2 next time. I also substituted coffee for water and added a little cocoa powder to make it darker in flavor. I can't wait to make this again...it was so delicious!

text:
I went with the 1/2c. oil 1/2 c. milk version using only 1 cup of the mini-chocolate chips and substituting coffee for the water. Also baked it in a 9x13. I frosted it with light cool whip and the remainder of the mini chips. Since I changed the original recipe I went with 5 stars. Good, but not the extreme chocolate flavor I was going for. The cake was moist with a nice crumb. It works really well as an alternative to a plain cake mix cake. If you bring it to a potluck, your cake will be eaten first!

text:
OMG - seriously the best cake I have ever had!  I sent the recipe hom to my husband who made it.  I noticed some of the (tiny) changes people made & sent it to him that way.  I told him to use a scant cup of oil, since some said it was a bit oily.  Also, he cut back the choc chips to about 1.5 cups.  It was not too oily at all!  And, the very best part was that he iced it all over w/ homemade choc frosting (just cocoa, butter, powdered sugar, vanilla, milk).  INCREDIBLE!!  And my favorite choc cake now!!!

text:
Just made this cake for a friend's B-day. I'm not a big chocolate fan but she requested a "chocolate, chocolate...cake". Well, this one delivered! AND, I, along with a handful of other "not big chocolate fans" helped her devour it. I topped it with "Satiny Chocolate Glaze" (also from this site and ridiculously easy to make; made it in the microwave as many reviewers suggested). This cake was moist and delicous and surprisingly not too sweet. Go Figure? Don't be surprised if this one should require a little more baking time. My Jenn-Air always bakes to perfection and is usually right on target with suggested baking times. However, with this one, I had to bake an extra 10-15 minutes. Aside from having to bake a little longer, I followed the recipe to a "T" and have no suggestions for improvement. Except, whenever a recipe calls for vegetable oil, I always use Canola oil...it's just better for ya.

text:
Oh my word--this cake is one of the best chocolate cakes I've ever eaten and so easy to make!  The first time I made it I used a devil's food cake mix, 3.9 oz pkg. of devil's food instant chocolate pudding, 1 bag of mini chocolate chips and the rest of the recipe as is.  It was moist and delicious and my family LOVED it!!!  The second cake (one week later) I used 1/2 c. oil, 1/3 c. milk and substituted strong black coffee for the water which gave it an even deeper chocolate flavor. Can't wait to try variations with different flavors.  This is now my standard cake recipe.  Thank you for this one!!!!!!

text:
OMG---this cake is requested all the time!! It's even been chosen over an icecream cake!! 
Use Jello pudding and not generic!  I also use Hershey's Special Dark Chocolate chips which makes it not so sweet.  
It's easy, throw it in a bowl and beat.  Very THICK batter so beware!  Don't over beat and careful when pouring into the bundt.  I cook it for 45 minutes.  I also don't let it cool in the bundt.  I find it to me more moist that way.

text:
I have tears of joy streaming down my face right now, and I made so many alterations to this recipe, I can't imagine how much BETTER it will be to make it as is! *sigh* When you're pregnant and want chocolate, make this. I mean it. My alterations/substitutions (because I was out of almost everything):

- No chocolate chips
- Used 4T egg whites from a carton, the kind that are purely egg whites, no yolk or yellow coloring
- 1/2 c oil & 1/2 c heavy whipping cream instead of 1 c oil
- 3.9 oz box of instant choco pudding instead of 5.9

And yet, after all that, STILL so moist, so delicious and dense yet 'fluffy'! And what cake mix flavor? Maybe my pregnant taste buds are dead, but this was the best chocolate cake ever! Yippee! Will make this over and over again!

text:
This cake is quick and easy to make and tastes delicious. I made it for my husband's birthday. He and my older son said it tastes like an intense brownie. I used the Satiny Chocolate Glaze from this site as other reviewers suggested. I also suggest serving with fresh sliced strawberries on top or raspberries to complement the sweetness.  I used a stone fluted pan and it took longer to cook. The outside top got a bit overdone before the inside was set. That's the only reason for a 4 versus a 5.

text:
This was so delicious and easy!  I made this for Mother's Day for both my mom and mom in law.  I followed the recipe and made the following changes according to other reviewers: used about 2 cups of mini semi-sweet chocolate chips and I substituted 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce for 1/2 the oil. The baking time took longer in my bundt pan and I turned down the temp near the end. It was so moist.  I used powdered sugar as the recipe said.  I think if I had used a glaze it would have been too much.  It stayed moist for days out of the refrigerator.  This is a definite keeper.  The next time I make it I will probably use low fat sour cream to make it less fat.

I did this recipe as is.  The morsels threw it off for me.  I should have listened to another who used mini morsels but now, they have to go! I had this deliciously created cake and then I'd get a nasty taste of cocoa from the morsels.  The morsels did not blend well for my tastes (although they melted) with the other chocolates. I know it will be a keeper of a recipe!

My sister (who loves chocolate cake) stated that it was the best chocolate cake she had ever eaten and now wants it made for her b-day! Since it was just the three of us I took what was left of the cake to work and got even more raves on my delicious cake. text:
This is an awesome chocolate cake recipe.  If you are a chocoholic, this cake is for you.  Just to make it even more chocolatey (if that is possible), I split the batter into two round pans.  In between the cakes, I used the chocolate genache recipe to make icing, not genache(with milk choc chips, and no alcohol).  Then to add even more richness, I used the same genache recipe and did dark chocolate genache and poured it over the entire cake.  It is the most chocolatiest thing ever!!

text:
This cake was wonderful!  Made it for Thanksgiving this past year and everyone loved it.  It's very true what one reviewer said about variations.  You can interchange the box cake mix flavor and the chips flavors and it usually works.  I practiced using a spice cake with vanilla pudding and chocolate chips that was great.  For the big day I used a dark fudge cake mix, fudge pudding, and peanut butter chips.  Both were very well liked!  Have fun!

country:
None
text:
The best chocolate cake of its kind.  It is simultaneously dark, rich, and not too heavy.  I topped it with Satiny Chocolate Glaze from this site--great pairing.

Be careful when you buy the instant pudding, because the weight of the boxes tends to vary.  I got a large chocolate with toffee chips that was 4.25 oz, so I added a small box of fudge pudding.  I used a dark chocolate cake mix and a mixture of white and milk chocolate chips.

text:
A good, moist cake.  Very chocolately without being too sweet, which is fantastic.  My one concern is that I think there is too much oil in the cake -- while the oil makes it moist, there is also a bit of an aftertaste and the texture reflects the oil content.  I don't know enough about baking to understand how to keep the moisture but get rid of the oil aftertaste.  Would appreciate some suggestions for oil alternatives. I used a basic vegetable oil (Wesson Best Blend).  Thanks to anyone who can offer help!

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
I followed the recipe as written, with the only modification being to substitute 1 cup of butterscotch chips for 1 of the cups of semi-sweet chocolate chips, as well as using two 9x9 inch cake pans. I also changed the cooking time from the listed 50 minutes to a little under 45 minutes. That, also, was a bit on the high side, as the corners of the cakes are a bit on the crunchy side. All in all, I like the taste of this cake. It's not overly sweet, which is something that I like, but the chocolate flavour still shines through. While I wouldn't go so far as to call it the Best Cake Ever, and I can see where some reviewers thought it had a 'boxed cake' taste, it is nonetheless a very good cake. I'll most likely be making it again.

text:
Oh my sooooooo yummy! 
used some of the tips from other reviews: turned oven down to 325 F, used dunkin hines fudge cake mix (was on sale), used 2 cups of mini chocolate chips (semi sweet), used 1/2 cup oil and 1/2 cup milk and topped it off with chocolate icing (betty crocker), and filled the center with strawberries.

made this cake saturday morning - tasted amazing on sunday evening when we finished it off - it was better the next day!

would not change a thing from what i did - was amazingly yummy!

text:
Oh My Goodness!! I made this cake for my twins' 12 birthday with a total of 15 kids at our house for a party and sleepover...these cakes were GONE in a matter of a few hours!! I made one 9x13 and one in a bundt pan as suggested. They both turned out AWESOME!! I used the "Rich Chocolate Frosting" on this site and the kids were going bananas over the cake as a whole! The chocolate chips made this cake!! I too used mini morsels it was oh so gooey!!

There were about 2 pieces left...the kids came home from school the next day...asked for the remainder of the cake...but I HAD EATEN IT!! I NEVER DO THAT! BUT IT WAS WAY TO HARD TO PASS UP!

I have 4 children and they have all asked that this be the staple birthday cake!!

Try it out! You won't be disappointed!

PS - You might want to have a tall glass of cold milk on hand!!!
Enjoy!
